quotes: Between 2010 and mid-2015, unemployment fell from around 7.9% to about 5.5% as employment expanded by roughly 2.45 million jobs.
national debt rose from circa 71% of GDP in 2010 to approximately 84% by 2016.
national debt rose from circa 71% of GDP in 2010 to approximately 84% by 2016.
He said in July 2013 that 'in the last decade we have had an immigration policy that's completely lax. The pressure it puts on our public services and communities is too great.'
In 2015 The Independent reported: 'The Conservatives have failed spectacularly to deliver their pledge to reduce net migration to less than 100,000 a year.'
The Office for National Statistics (ONS) announced a net flow of 298,000 migrants to the UK in the 12 months to September 2014—up from 210,000 in the previous year.
In 2014 Cameron dismissed warnings that his cuts to the UK defence budget had left it less than a 'first class-player in terms of defence' and no longer a 'full partner' to the United States.
In the July 2015 budget, Chancellor George Osborne announced that the UK defence spending would meet the NATO target of 2% of GDP.
With then Foreign Secretary William Hague speaking to NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen (left) at the London Conference on Libya, March 2011
